alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 6:09PM EDT until May 21 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Greensville County in southeastern Virginia... Southwestern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Northern Brunswick County in south central Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 608 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Alberta, or near Lawrenceville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Alberta around 620 PM EDT. McKenney around 655 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Ordsburg, Danieltown, Cochran, Callaville, Rawlings, Dolphin, Warfield, Meredithville and Prices Mill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
